paper_metadata.title: Genetic screening for hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis with polyneuropathy in western Sicily: Two years of experience in a neurological clinic
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.demographics: Age range not specified; includes both male and female patients.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: After clinical and neurophysiological evaluation, seven patients (21%) had evidence of sensory–motor polyneuropathy and were started on treatment.
26 presymptomatic carriers of TTR mutation began regular follow-up.

functional_data.summary: The Phe64Leu mutation is associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: Phe64Leu was the most frequent genotype found in the study.
key_quotes: Five mutations occurred among ATTRv‐PN patients, with Phe64Leu being the most frequent genotype.
Interestingly, His90Asn, Val20Ala, and Ser77Phe were reported for the first time in Sicily.

patients.demographics: Age range not specified; includes both male and female patients.

functional_data.summary: The pathogenic role of the His90Asn variant was confirmed by the presence of amyloid deposits in a salivary gland biopsy.

variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on clinical findings.
variants.additional_notes: His90Asn was confirmed as pathogenic in one patient.
key_quotes: The pathogenic role of the His90Asn variant in our patient was confirmed by the presence of amyloid deposits in a salivary gland biopsy.

patients.demographics: Age range not specified; includes both male and female patients.

functional_data.summary: The pathogenic role of the Val20Ala variant is supported by a single report.

variants.evidence_level: Low evidence due to limited data.
variants.additional_notes: Val20Ala was reported for the first time in this study.
key_quotes: For Val20Ala a single report supported a pathogenetic role.

patients.demographics: Age range not specified; includes both male and female patients.

functional_data.summary: Ser77Phe has been reported as pathogenetic.

variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on clinical findings.
variants.additional_notes: Ser77Phe was reported for the first time in this study.
key_quotes: Among them, Ser77Phe has already been clearly reported as pathogenetic.

tables_processed.table_caption: Clinical features in screened positive versus negative patients.
Misdiagnoses in hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis patients.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant variants in the TTR gene were extracted, including penetrance data.
